Chinese Traditional (CHT): 戰人以凶狠的神色，朝在聽電話的真里亞喊道。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 战人以凶狠的神色，朝在听电话的真里亚喊道。

Umineko Project (UP): You couldn't blame him...... Right now, the only humans left alive on the island were himself, Maria, Gohda, and Kumasawa.
Steam (ST): You couldn't blame him... Right now, the only humans left alive on the island were himself, Maria, Gohda, and Kumasawa.
PC Japanese (JP): それも当然のこと……。今のこの島で生き残っている人間は、自分と真里亞と、郷田と熊沢。
Russian (RU): Его вряд ли можно было винить... На данный момент в живых на острове остались лишь он сам, Мария, Года и Кумасава.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Você não podia culpá‐lo...... Naquele momento, os únicos humanos que sobraram vivos na ilha eram ele, Maria, Gohda e Kumasawa.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 會凶也是當然的事……。此刻還倖存於這個島上的，也就自己與真里亞，鄉田與熊澤。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 会凶也是当然的事……。此刻还幸存于这个岛上的，也就自己与真里亚，乡田与熊泽。

Umineko Project (UP): But there was no way those two could call when they were locked up in the gardening storehouse.
Steam (ST): But there was no way those two could call after being locked up in the gardening storehouse.
PC Japanese (JP): しかし２人は園芸倉庫に閉じ込められているから電話を出来るはずもない。
Russian (RU): Последние двое не имели возможности позвать на помощь, будучи заперты в садовом складе.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Mas era impossível para que os dois ligassem para eles sendo que estavam presos no depósito do jardim.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 那兩人因為被關在園藝倉庫裡，所以不可能打來電話。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 那两人因为被关在园艺仓库里，所以不可能打来电话。

Umineko Project (UP): ......Which meant.........there was only one person.{n}It had to be Kinzo.
Steam (ST): ...Which meant......there was only one person left. It had to be Kinzo.
PC Japanese (JP): ……となると、………もう１人。金蔵しかいない。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): ……となると、………もう１人。{n}金蔵しかいない。
Russian (RU): Это означало, что оставался только один человек.{n}Им должен был быть Кинзо.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......O que significa.........que só poderia ser uma pessoa.{n}Tinha que ser Kinzo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……如此一來，………那就只剩下一人。{n}金藏。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……如此一来，………那就只剩下一人。{n}金藏。

Umineko Project (UP): As she happily chatted with the person on the other end of the phone, Maria slowly turned to face Battler.
Steam (ST): After continuing her pleasant chat with the person on the other end of the phone for a while, Maria slowly turned to face Battler.
PC Japanese (JP): 真里亞は電話の相手と楽しそうに談笑しながら、そのままゆっくりと戦人に振り返る。

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Enquanto ela conversava animada com a pessoa do outro lado da linha, Maria lentamente se virou para Battler.

Chinese Simplified (CN): 真里亚边与打来电话之人开心地谈笑，边慢慢地把脸转向了战人。

Umineko Project (UP): .........And, with an unsettling expression on her face, she laughed with a "kihihi{0}hi{0}hi{0}hi{0}hi{0}hihihi".{n}......It felt almost as though the person on the other end of the line was chatting about Battler.

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): .........E, com uma expressão inquieta em seu rosto, ela riu com um "kihihi{0}hi{0}hi{0}hi{0}hi{0}hihihi".{n}......Era quase como se a pessoa do outro lado da linha estivesse conversando com Battler.

PC Japanese (JP): 郷田さんは体格もいいし、戦力として期待できる。熊沢さんは古参の使用人としての知識や土地勘が大きな武器になるだろう。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 郷田さんは体格もいいし、戦力として期待できる。{n}熊沢さんは古参の使用人としての知識や土地勘が大きな武器になるだろう。
Russian (RU): Года‐сан наделён довольно крупным телосложением, так что я могу рассчитывать на его силу.{n}Кумасава же, являясь слугой с огромным стажем, хорошо знает местность, поэтому может стать ценным оружием.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O Gohda‐san é um homem corpulento, então eu provavelmente posso contar com ele para adicionar um pouco de músculo.{n}O conhecimento e familiaridade da Kumasawa‐san como serviçal veterana também pode ser uma boa arma.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 鄉田體格不錯，能期待他成為戰力。{n}熊澤婆婆那身為老一輩傭人的知識與對此地的熟悉程度也會成為巨大的武器吧。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 乡田体格不错，能期待他成为战力。{n}熊泽婆婆那身为老一辈佣人的知识与对此地的熟悉程度也会成为巨大的武器吧。

Umineko Project (UP): Both of them have master keys, and they know more about the mansion than I do. ......They're pretty reliable allies.
Steam (ST): Both of them have master keys, and they know more about the mansion than I do. They'll be pretty reliable allies.
PC Japanese (JP): 二人ともマスターキーを持っているし、屋敷についても自分より詳しい。……かなり頼もしい味方だった。
Russian (RU): У них есть универсальные ключи, и они знают о доме куда больше моего. Они надёжные помощники.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ambos têm chaves mestras, e conhecem a mansão melhor do que eu. ......Eles são aliados confiáveis.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 他們兩個都帶著總鑰匙，並且還比我熟悉大屋。……可謂是相當可靠的伙伴。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 他们两个都带着总钥匙，并且还比我熟悉大屋。……可谓是相当可靠的伙伴。

Umineko Project (UP): As I banged on the shutter and called out for them to open it, I remembered that there was nothing they could do from the inside.
Steam (ST): As I banged on the shutter and called out for them to open it, I remembered that there was nothing they could do from the inside.
PC Japanese (JP): シャッターを叩きながら開けてくれと呼び掛け、中の彼らにはどうしようもないのだということを思い出す。
Russian (RU): Я принялся стучать по затвору и кричать, чтобы они открыли дверь, но затем вспомнил, что они не могут ничего сделать изнутри.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Enquanto eu batia no {i:shutter} e os chamava para abrirem, lembrei que não havia como eles abrirem por dentro.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 我邊拍著卷閘門，邊叫他們開門，然後我想起來了，身在裡面的他們是怎麼都沒法開門的。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 我边拍着卷闸门，边叫他们开门，然后我想起来了，身在里面的他们是怎么都没法开门的。

Umineko Project (UP): I would have to get the key back from them and open the shutter myself.
Steam (ST): I would have to get the key back from them before opening the door.
PC Japanese (JP): 彼らに鍵を返してもらい、開けてやらねばならない。
Russian (RU): Мне потребуется взять у них ключ, чтобы открыть дверь.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eu teria que pegar a chave de volta e abrir eu mesmo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 必須從他們那拿回鑰匙，由我從外面開門。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 必须从他们那拿回钥匙，由我从外面开门。

Umineko Project (UP): I went around to the side, knocked on the small latticed window there, and opened it up.
Steam (ST): I rounded the corner, knocked on the small latticed window there, and opened it.
PC Japanese (JP): 脇に回り、小さな格子窓をノックし、そこを開ける。
Russian (RU): Я завернул за угол, постучал в небольшое решетчатое окно и открыл его.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eu fui até a lateral, bati na pequena janela de treliça e a abri.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 我繞到邊上，先是敲了敲，接著打開了那扇小格窗。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 我绕到边上，先是敲了敲，接着打开了那扇小格窗。

Steam (ST): "Gohda-san, Kumasawa baa-chan...! It's Battler...!! Hey, come on, get up, ...h...ey......"

Chinese Simplified (CN): 「乡田、熊泽婆婆…！是我战人…！！喂，起床了………，……喂…………」

Steam (ST): The scene in the shed, lit by a dim lightbulb, ...was very...strange...

Russian (RU): Сцена в сарае, освещённом тусклой лампочкой, была... очень... странной...

Chinese Simplified (CN): 被灯泡的昏暗灯光所照亮的仓库内的情景，………实在是过于，……怪异……。

Speaker: Ushiromiya Battler
Russian (RU): "Года... са... н... Кумасава... са... н..."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): [=UP]

Umineko Project (UP): From a low ceiling beam.........hung two thick ropes, ......and at the ends, ......Gohda‐san and Kumasawa‐san............were hanging...by their necks.....
Steam (ST): From a low ceiling beam... ...hung two thick ropes, ...and at the ends, ...Gohda-san and Kumasawa-san... ...were hanging...by their necks...
PC Japanese (JP): 天井の低い梁に、………太いロープが２本吊るされ、……それぞれに、……郷田さんと熊沢さんが、…………首を、…吊るされているのだ……。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 天井の低い梁に、………太いロープが２本吊るされ、……それぞれに、……郷田さんと熊沢さんが、…………首を、…吊るされているのだ……。
Russian (RU): С лампы на потолке... свисали две толстые веревки... а на их концах... Года‐сан и Кумасава‐сан... висели... привязанные за шею...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): De um feixe debaixo do teto.........dependurados por duas cordas grossas, ......ao fim delas, ......o Gohda‐san e a Kumasawa‐san............estavam pendurados...pelos pescoços.....
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 從天花板低梁上，………垂下了兩根粗粗的繩索，……它們分別吊著，……鄉田與熊澤婆婆的、…………脖、…子……。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 从天花板低梁上，………垂下了两根粗粗的绳索，……它们分别吊着，……乡田与熊泽婆婆的、…………脖、…子……。

Umineko Project (UP): It was dim, and I was looking through a narrow gap between all the various pieces of equipment strewn about, so I couldn't make out any more detail than that.
Steam (ST): It was dim and cramped because of the various pieces of equipment strewn about, so I couldn't make out the situation clearly.
PC Japanese (JP): 薄暗いし、色々と荷物がごちゃごちゃ置かれている狭間からなので、その様子はそれ以上詳しくはわからない。

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Estava escuro, e eu estava olhando por uma pequena fresta entre os equipamentos espalhados, por isso não consegui ver com muitos detalhes.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 由於光線昏暗，再加上我是通過亂糟糟地堆著的物品的縫隙往裡看的，所以掌握不了更具體的情況。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 由于光线昏暗，再加上我是通过乱糟糟地堆着的物品的缝隙往里看的，所以掌握不了更具体的情况。

Umineko Project (UP): ......But when they showed not even a tremor after I called out to them, and because of the way the loops around their necks seemed to carry the full weight of their bodies, I could sense no trace of life from them......
Steam (ST): ...But when they showed not even a tremor after I called out to them, and because of the way the loops around their necks seemed to carry the full weight of their bodies, I could sense no trace of life from them...
PC Japanese (JP): ……しかし、声を掛けてもぴくりとも反応せず、完全に首のロープに全ての体重を預けきっている様子から、生きている気配を感じ取ることは出来なかった……。
Russian (RU): ......Но когда они даже не дрогнули после того, как я им крикнул, из‐за того, что петли на шее, судя по всему, несли тяжесть всего тела, я почувствовал, я осознал, что не ощущаю в них жизни...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Mas quando eles não demonstraram nenhum tremor depois que eu os chamei, e por causa da forma como os nós em volta de seus pescoços parecia carregar todo o peso do corpo deles, eu não consegui ver qualquer traço de vida neles......
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……不過，從對於我的喊聲一動不動毫無反應，完全把體重壓在套住脖子的繩套上的情形上，感覺不到一絲絲生氣……。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……不过，从对于我的喊声一动不动毫无反应，完全把体重压在套住脖子的绳套上的情形上，感觉不到一丝丝生气……。

Speaker: Ushiromiya Battler
Steam (ST): "You've gotta be......kidding me, ...right......? ...Why......?"
Russian (RU): "Вы должно быть... разыгрываете меня... да? ......Почему?"

Steam (ST): The shutter was still closed.
PC Japanese (JP): シャッターは閉まったままなのだ。

Chinese Traditional (CHT): 卷閘門關得好好的。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 卷闸门关得好好的。

Steam (ST): ...And there was only a single key, which had supposedly been given to Gohda-san.
PC Japanese (JP): ……そして鍵はひとつしかなく、郷田さんが預かったはず。

Chinese Simplified (CN): ……而且那仅此一把的钥匙应该在乡田身上。

Umineko Project (UP): So how did the culprit......open the shutter and kill the two of them inside......?
Steam (ST): So how had the culprit...opened the shutter and killed both of them inside...?
PC Japanese (JP): なのにどうやって犯人は、……シャッターを開けて、中の二人を殺したんだよ……？
Russian (RU): Тогда как преступник отпер дверь и убил их обоих внутри?
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Então como o culpado......abriu o {i:shutter} e matou os dois lá dentro......?
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 可儘管如此，犯人又是怎麼開的，……卷閘門，將在裡面的兩人殺害的啊……？

Steam (ST): No, wait, they weren't necessarily killed... If this is a suicide...

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): いいや、殺されたとは限らない…。{n}これは自殺なんだとしたら……。
Russian (RU): Нет, стойте‐ка, они ведь не обязательно убиты...{n}Если это самоубийство...

Chinese Simplified (CN): 不、不一定是被杀…。{n}若是自杀的话……。

Steam (ST): ...That way, this closed room makes sense, but I don't know why they would hang themselves and commit suicide...!!
PC Japanese (JP): ……密室のつじつまは合うけど、二人が首を吊って自殺する意味がわからない…！！

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Dessa forma, esse quarto fechado faria sentido, mas eu não faço ideia do que os levou a se enforcarem...!!

Chinese Simplified (CN): ……虽然情况与密室相符，但他们两个为什么上吊自杀啊…？！！

Steam (ST): Feebly, ...I slumped down on the spot.

Steam (ST): ......No, there's also that insane woman calling herself {f:5:Beatrice}...

Umineko Project (UP): I got the crying out of the way while I could... So that all my weak emotions would be squeezed out with my tears...
Steam (ST): Might as well cry while I can... ...So that my frail emotions will be squeezed out with my tears...
PC Japanese (JP): 今の内に、泣いておく…。弱々しい気持ちを全て涙と一緒に、搾り出しておくために…。
Russian (RU): Почему бы мне сейчас не поплакать? Так мои эмоции хотя бы выйдут со слезами...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eu gritei o mais alto que eu pude... Para que todas as minhas emoções fossem expelidas junto com minhas lágrimas...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 就趁現在，哭吧…。去將那懦弱的情感與眼淚一起，排出體外…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 就趁现在，哭吧…。去将那懦弱的情感与眼泪一起，排出体外…。

Umineko Project (UP): Then, ......I straightened up, and gazed into the darkness in the direction of the mansion.
Steam (ST): Then, ...I straightened up and gazed into the darkness in the direction of the mansion.
PC Japanese (JP): それから俺は、……背筋を伸ばし、屋敷のある方角の暗闇を見た。
Russian (RU): Затем я выпрямился и глянул в темноту в направлении особняка.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Então, ......eu me endireitei e olhei para a escuridão, na direção da mansão.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 哭完後，……我挺直腰板，望向了大屋方向的黑暗。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 哭完后，……我挺直腰板，望向了大屋方向的黑暗。

Umineko Project (UP): .........At the entrance to the mansion, the witch is waiting.
Steam (ST): ......At the entrance to the mansion, the witch is waiting.
PC Japanese (JP): ………屋敷の玄関に、魔女が待ち受ける。
Russian (RU): .........У входа в особняк меня ждёт ведьма.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): .........Na entrada da mansão, a bruxa está esperando.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ………魔女正在大屋的正門等著。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ………魔女正在大屋的正门等着。

Umineko Project (UP): I'll go, ......and settle this.
Steam (ST): I'll go...and settle this.
PC Japanese (JP): 行って、……ケリをつけてやる。
Russian (RU): Я пойду... и разберусь с этим раз и навсегда.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eu vou ir, ......e acabar com isso.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 走，……去做個了結。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 走，……去做个了结。

Umineko Project (UP): I'll find the source of this weird, blood‐soaked night, ......and crush her with my own hands...!
Steam (ST): I'll find the source of this weird, insane night...and crush her with my own hands...!
PC Japanese (JP): このおかしなおかしな、狂った夜の元凶を、……俺の手で、ぶっ潰してやる…！
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): このおかしなおかしな、血まみれの夜の元凶を、……俺の手で、ぶっ潰してやる…！
Russian (RU): Я найду источник этой странной, ужасной ночи... И раздавлю его собственными руками!
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eu vou encontrar a fonte dessa bizarra noite banhada à sangue, ......e esmagá‐la com minhas próprias mãos...!
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 用我的手來，幹掉這場荒唐怪異的瘋狂之夜的，……元凶…！
Chinese Simplified (CN): 用我的手来，干掉这场荒唐怪异的疯狂之夜的，……元凶…！

Umineko Project (UP): Amidst the pouring rain, ......I walked through the rose garden without an umbrella, letting myself get soaked.
Steam (ST): Amidst the pouring rain, ...I walked through the rose garden without an umbrella, letting myself get soaked.
PC Japanese (JP): 土砂降りの雨の中、……俺は傘もなく、濡れるに任せて、薔薇庭園を歩く。
Russian (RU): Я шёл через розарий под проливным дождём без зонтика, наплевав на то, что промок до нитки.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Em meio à chuva torrencial, ......eu caminhei através do jardim de rosas, sem guarda‐chuva, ficando completamente ensopado.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 冒著傾盆大雨，……我傘也不撐，任由雨水淋濕身體，走在玫瑰庭園之中。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 冒着倾盆大雨，……我伞也不撑，任由雨水淋湿身体，走在玫瑰庭园之中。

Umineko Project (UP): ......I could see the arbor in the distance.
Steam (ST): ...I could see the arbor on the other side.
PC Japanese (JP): ……向こうに東屋が見えた。
Russian (RU): Тут я увидел беседку на другой стороне.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Eu conseguia ver o gazebo ao longe.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……在花叢對面，看到了亭子。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……在花丛对面，看到了亭子。

Umineko Project (UP): According to Jessica, it seemed that George‐aniki had also been killed...
Steam (ST): According to Jessica, it seemed that George-aniki had also been killed...
PC Japanese (JP): 朱志香の話では、譲治の兄貴も殺されたらしい…。
Russian (RU): По словам Джессики, Джордж‐аники тоже был мертв...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): De acordo com a Jessica, parece que é onde o George‐aniki também foi morto...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 據朱志香所說，讓治大哥好像也已遇害…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 据朱志香所说，让治大哥好像也已遇害…。

Umineko Project (UP): Well, by this point, there's no need to worry about the lives of any hostages.{n}......I left the path, aiming for the arbor.
Steam (ST): Well, by this point, there's no need to worry about the lives of any hostages. ...I left the path, aiming for the arbor.
PC Japanese (JP): どうせ、今さら人質の命も何もない。……俺は、道を外れ、東屋を目指す。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): どうせ、今さら人質の命も何もない。{n}……俺は、道を外れ、東屋を目指す。
Russian (RU): Ну, сейчас уже нет необходимости заботиться о жизни любого из заложников.{n}......Я свернул с пути и направился к беседке.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Bem, agora não há motivos para se preocupar com a vida dos reféns.{n}......Eu saí do meu caminho e fui em direção ao gazebo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 反正，現如今，人質的命是一條都不剩了。{n}……我換了條道，朝亭子走去。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 反正，现如今，人质的命是一条都不剩了。{n}……我换了条道，朝亭子走去。

Umineko Project (UP): Then, ............I saw George‐aniki's weather‐beaten corpse...
Steam (ST): Then, ......I saw George-aniki's weather-beaten corpse...
PC Japanese (JP): そして、…………譲治の兄貴の死体が、雨曝しになっているのを見た…。
Russian (RU): И вот тут‐то моему взору предстал обветренный труп Джорджа‐аники...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Então, ............eu vi o cadáver do George‐aniki batido pelo tempo...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 接著，…………我看到了，讓治大哥暴露在雨中的屍體…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 接着，…………我看到了，让治大哥暴露在雨中的尸体…。

Speaker: Ushiromiya Battler
Chinese Simplified (CN): [=CHT]

Umineko Project (UP): The corpse was in front of the arbor.
Steam (ST): The corpse was in front of the arbor.
PC Japanese (JP): 死体は、東屋の前にあった。
Russian (RU): Труп лежал перед беседкой.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O corpo estava em frente ao gazebo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 屍體倒在亭子前。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 尸体倒在亭子前。

Umineko Project (UP): If he could have died under the arbor, he would at least have been spared being beaten down upon by the rain...
Steam (ST): If he had died under the arbor, he might have at least been spared being beaten down upon by the rain...
PC Japanese (JP): せめて東屋の中で死ねたなら、雨曝しにだけはならずに済んだろうに…。
Russian (RU): Если бы он умер в беседке, то он хотя бы избежал лежания под дождем...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Se ao menos ele tivesse morrido dentro, ao menos teria sido poupado de ser encharcado pela chuva...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 要是能死在亭子裡的話，大哥就至少不用淋雨了吧…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 要是能死在亭子里的话，大哥就至少不用淋雨了吧…。

Umineko Project (UP): There was a gaping hole in Aniki's forehead, as though he had been shot with a gun.
Steam (ST): In Aniki's forehead was a gaping hole, as though he'd been shot with a gun.
PC Japanese (JP): 兄貴の額には、まるで銃で撃たれたかのような穴がぽっかりと開いていた。
Russian (RU): Во лбу Аники зияла дыра, как будто его застрелили из ружья.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Havia um buraco aberto na testa do aniki, como se tivesse levado um tiro.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 大哥的額頭上，有個像是遭到了槍擊所留下的洞。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 大哥的额头上，有个像是遭到了枪击所留下的洞。

Umineko Project (UP): Perhaps because the rain had washed everything away, his face wasn't covered with blood, ......and so he looked almost like he was sleeping.
Steam (ST): Perhaps because the rain had washed everything away, his face wasn't covered with blood, ...so he looked almost like he was sleeping.
PC Japanese (JP): 雨が全て洗い流してしまったせいか、顔面が血塗れということはなく、……そのせいで、眠っているようにさえ見える。
Russian (RU): Быть может потому, что дождь омыл его, на лице Аники не было крови... Он выглядел так, словно спал.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Talvez porque a chuva havia lavado tudo, seu rosto não estava coberto de sangue, ......e ele quase parecia estar dormindo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 是因為雨水洗刷掉了一切嗎，大哥臉上並無多少血污，……因此，看起來仿彿就像是睡著了一般。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 是因为雨水洗刷掉了一切吗，大哥脸上并无多少血污，……因此，看起来仿佛就像是睡着了一般。

Umineko Project (UP): ...However, the deep red his clothes were stained still provided the evidence that a large amount of blood had flowed out...
Steam (ST): ...However, his clothes were stained a deep red, and there were still signs that a large amount of blood had flowed out...
PC Japanese (JP): …しかし、服は真っ赤に染まり、大量の血が流れた痕跡を未だに残していた…。
Russian (RU): ...Но его одежда была окрашена в тёмно‐алый, и всё ещё сохранились признаки серьёзной кровопотери...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Mas o vermelho escuro manchado em suas roupas ainda se mantinha como uma evidência da grande quantia de sangue que ele havia perdido...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …不過，他的衣服被染得通紅，還留著曾淌下過大量鮮血的痕跡…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …不过，他的衣服被染得通红，还留着曾淌下过大量鲜血的痕迹…。

Umineko Project (UP): How happy I'd be if he were sleeping, or else pretending to be dead...
Steam (ST): How happy I'd be if he were sleeping, or else pretending to be dead...
PC Japanese (JP): 眠っていたり、あるいは死んでいるフリをしていたなら、どんなに嬉しいことか…。
Russian (RU): Как бы я был счастлив, если бы он спал или только притворялся мёртвым...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Como seria feliz se ele estivesse dormindo, ou até se fingindo de morto...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 這要是睡著了，又或是在裝死的話，那該有多麼令人高興啊…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 这要是睡着了，又或是在装死的话，那该有多么令人高兴啊…。

Umineko Project (UP): ......But Aniki's eyes remained open, even though the rain sprayed against them.
Steam (ST): ...But even though the rain sprayed against Aniki's eyes, they remained open.
PC Japanese (JP): ……しかし、雨が吹き付けるにもかかわらず、兄貴の目は見開いたまま。
Russian (RU): ......Несмотря на то, что дождь капал на них, его глаза были открыты.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Mas os olhos do aniki permaneceram abertos, mesmo com a chuva batendo sobre eles.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……然而，大哥睜著的雙眼，一動不動地任憑雨滴擊打。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……然而，大哥睁着的双眼，一动不动地任凭雨滴击打。

Umineko Project (UP): ......And......the hole in his forehead was, without a hint of a joke, ......the real thing...
Steam (ST): ...And...the hole in his forehead was no joke, ...but absolutely real...
PC Japanese (JP): ……そして、……額の穴は、冗談抜きで、……本物だった…。
Russian (RU): И... дыра у него во лбу была настоящей на полном серьёзе...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......E......o buraco em sua testa era, sem brincadeira, ......era real...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……並且，……他額頭上的洞，是個不開玩笑的，……真傢伙…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……并且，……他额头上的洞，是个不开玩笑的，……真家伙…。

Umineko Project (UP): There had been a faint chance...that Gohda‐san and Kumasawa‐san hanging by their necks in the gardening shed could have been a bad joke.
Steam (ST): There had been a faint chance that even Gohda-san and Kumasawa-san hanging by their necks in the gardening shed had been them playing a bad joke.
PC Japanese (JP): さっきの園芸倉庫の首吊りは、……ひょっとすると郷田さんたちの悪趣味な冗談かもしれない可能性も、わずかにはあった。
Russian (RU): Во мне теплилась слабая надежда, что подвешенные за шеи в садовом складе Года‐сан и Кумасава‐сан были всего‐навсего плохой шуткой.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Havia uma mínima chance...de que o Gohda‐san e Kumasawa‐san terem se enforcado no depósito fosse uma piada de mau gosto.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 剛才園藝倉庫兩人的上吊，……還留有著一絲絲的，搞不好是鄉田他們在開低級趣味的玩笑的可能性。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 刚才园艺仓库两人的上吊，……还留有着一丝丝的，搞不好是乡田他们在开低级趣味的玩笑的可能性。

Umineko Project (UP): But that naive possibility had now been completely denied.
Steam (ST): But that naive possibility had now been completely denied.
PC Japanese (JP): しかし、その甘えた可能性は、完全に否定される。
Russian (RU): Но теперь эта наивная надежда оказалась растоптана.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Mas essa ingênua possibilidade foi completamente negada agora.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 然而，這個天真的可能性被完全地否定掉了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 然而，这个天真的可能性被完全地否定掉了。

Umineko Project (UP): And, as I looked at this corpse, I became completely sure.
Steam (ST): And, as I looked at this corpse, I became completely sure.
PC Japanese (JP): そして、この死体を見て、完全に確信する。
Russian (RU): И, глядя на этот труп, я окончательно уверился.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): E, ao olhar para esse cadáver, eu tive ciência disso.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 並且，在看了這具屍體後，我完全地確信了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 并且，在看了这具尸体后，我完全地确信了。

Umineko Project (UP): Just as Gohda‐san had once said. ......The enemy came to take lives as though these lives were pieces on a chess board.
Steam (ST): Just as Gohda-san had once said. ...The enemy had come to take lives like pieces on a chessboard.
PC Japanese (JP): かつて郷田さんは言っていた。……敵は、チェスの駒を奪うかのように、命を奪ってくると。
Russian (RU): Как когда‐то сказал Года‐сан. Противник пришёл, чтобы забрать жизни, как будто эти самые жизни являлись фигурами на шахматной доске.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Assim como o Gohda‐san havia dito. ......O inimigo veio para tomar vidas como se fossem peças em um tabuleiro de xadrez.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 之前，鄉田所說的那句話。……敵人奪人性命，就像吃掉國際象棋的棋子。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 之前，乡田所说的那句话。……敌人夺人性命，就像吃掉国际象棋的棋子。

Speaker: Ushiromiya Battler
Umineko Project (UP): ".........Yeah, ......there's no mistake. ......It seems that old geezer and the witch.........really don't view our lives as anything more than that......"
Steam (ST): "......Aaaah, ...there's no mistake. ...It seems that old geezer and the witch... ...really don't view our lives as anything more than that..."
PC Japanese (JP): 「………あぁ、……間違いない。……クソジジイと魔女は、………俺たちの命なんて、本当にその程度にしか思ってないらしい……。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「………あぁ、……間違いない。……クソジジイと魔女は、………俺たちの命なんて、本当にその程度にしか思ってないらしい……」
Russian (RU): ".........А‐а‐а‐а‐а... здесь нет никакой ошибки. ......Похоже, что старый хрыч и ведьма действительно не рассматривают наши жизни как‐либо иначе..."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ".........Sim, ......não há dúvidas. ......Parece que aquele velho filho da puta e aquela bruxa.........não veem nossas vidas como nada mais do que isso......"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「………啊啊，……毫無疑問。……看來，那混帳老頭與魔女，………是真的只把我們的命當成那種程度的東西……」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「………啊啊，……毫无疑问。……看来，那混帐老头与魔女，………是真的只把我们的命当成那种程度的东西……」

Umineko Project (UP): ...That damn witch, when she was on the phone...{n}She talked about us like we were "on the game board"......
Steam (ST): ...That damn witch said something over the phone... Something about us being "on the game board"...
PC Japanese (JP): …あの魔女め、電話でこう言いやがったな…。俺たちのことを、“ゲーム盤の上”で、みたいに……。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): …あの魔女め、電話でこう言いやがったな…。{n}俺たちのことを、“ゲーム盤の上”で、みたいに……。
Russian (RU): Эта проклятая ведьма что‐то сказала по телефону...{n}Что‐то о том, что мы на "шахматной доске"...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Aquela bruxa de merda, quando estava no telefone...{n}Ela falou sobre nós como se estivéssemos "no tabuleiro"......
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …那個混帳魔女，在電話中這麼說過…。{n}說了像是，我們是在“棋盤上”之類的話……。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …那个混帐魔女，在电话中这么说过…。{n}说了像是，我们是在“棋盘上”之类的话……。

Speaker: Ushiromiya Battler
Umineko Project (UP): "...Perfect...... ......Right, she thinks this is a game, huh...... Then, ...in the same way you killed everyone like it was a game, .........it's alright if I kill all of you like it's a game as well, right......?"
Steam (ST): "...Perfect... ...I see, she thinks this is a game... Then, ...if you killed everyone like it was a game, ......it's okay if I kill you all like it's a game, right...?
PC Japanese (JP): 「…上等だぜ……。……そうかよ、こいつはゲームのつもりかよ……。なら、…お前らがみんなをゲームみたいに殺したように、………俺がお前らをゲームのように殺してもいいわけだよな……？
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「…上等だぜ……。……そうかよ、こいつはゲームのつもりかよ……。なら、…お前らがみんなをゲームみたいに殺したように、………俺がお前らをゲームのように殺してもいいわけだよな……？」
Russian (RU): "...Отлично.........Насколько я понял, она думает, будто это игра... Тогда... точно так же, как ты убила всех, словно это была игра, то я не совершу ничего дурного, если тоже поиграю и убью тебя, не так ли?"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "...Perfeito...... ......Então ela acha que isso é um jogo......? Então, ...da mesma forma que você matou todos como se fosse um jogo, .........está tudo bem se eu matar vocês como se fosse um jogo, certo......?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「…好極了……。……原來如此啊，這算是場遊戲嘛……。那麼，…就跟你們如玩遊戲般地殺害大家一樣，………我也是可以，如玩遊戲般地殺死你們的吧……？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「…好极了……。……原来如此啊，这算是场游戏嘛……。那么，…就跟你们如玩游戏般地杀害大家一样，………我也是可以，如玩游戏般地杀死你们的吧……？」

Speaker: Ushiromiya Battler
Steam (ST): ......Prepare yourself, ...{f:5:Beatrice}......"
PC Japanese (JP): …………首を洗ってやがれ……。……ベアトリーチェ………。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「…………首を洗ってやがれ……。……ベアトリーチェ………」
Russian (RU): ".........Готовься... ...{f:5:Беатриче}..."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「…………去洗乾淨脖子吧……。……貝阿朵莉切………」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「…………去洗干净脖子吧……。……贝阿朵莉切………」

Umineko Project (UP): The lightning caused the mansion's vast shadow to emerge.
Steam (ST): The lightning caused the mansion's vast shadow to rise up.
PC Japanese (JP): 稲光に屋敷の巨大な影が浮かび上がる。
Russian (RU): Блеснувшая молния заставила подняться внушительную тень особняка.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O raio fez com que a imensa sombra da mansão emergisse.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 閃電將大屋照成了巨大的剪影。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 闪电将大屋照成了巨大的剪影。

Umineko Project (UP): ......Finally, ......the mansion.
Steam (ST): ...Finally, ...the mansion.
PC Japanese (JP): ……いよいよ、屋敷、……だ。
Russian (RU): ...... И вот, наконец... Особняк.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Finalmente, ......a mansão.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……終於，到，……大屋了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……终于，到，……大屋了。

Umineko Project (UP): As the massive shape came into view, there was no silhouette of any person.{n}It seemed that there weren't any underlings waiting for me in a pack, or anything like that.
Steam (ST): As the massive shape came into view, there was no silhouette of any person. It seemed that there weren't any underlings waiting for me in a pack, or anything like that.
PC Japanese (JP): 見えてくるその巨大な姿に、人影はない。俺の歓迎のために、手下どもがぞろりと待ち受けている、ということはないようだった。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 見えてくるその巨大な姿に、人影はない。{n}俺の歓迎のために、手下どもがぞろりと待ち受けている、ということはないようだった。
Russian (RU): В поле моего зрения с его громадой попал и силуэт какого‐то человека.{n}Встречающий комитет из шестёрок‐приспешников поблизости не наблюдался.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Conforme sua massiva forma entrava em meu campo de visão, não havia a silhueta de nenhuma pessoa. Parece que nenhum dos subordinados estavam esperando por mim, nem nado do tipo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 映入眼簾的巨大建築物上沒有人影。{n}看來並沒有為了歡迎我而命令手下們嚴陣以待。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 映入眼帘的巨大建筑物上没有人影。{n}看来并没有为了欢迎我而命令手下们严阵以待。

Umineko Project (UP): .........According to Kyrie‐san, there were a large number of attendants with goat heads.
Steam (ST): ......According to Kyrie-san, there were massive amounts of attendants with goat heads.
PC Japanese (JP): ………霧江さんの話によると、山羊の頭をした従者、という連中が相当大勢いるらしい。
Russian (RU): Кирие‐сан рассказывала мне о тьме‐тьмущей козлоголовых дворецких.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): .........De acordo com a Kyrie‐san, há um grande número de mordomos com cabeças de cabra.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ………聽霧江姐說，貌似有好多好多長著山羊腦袋的侍從。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ………听雾江姐说，貌似有好多好多长着山羊脑袋的侍从。

Umineko Project (UP): At least for now, I couldn't sense...any large group like that hiding and staring at me...
Steam (ST): At least for now, I couldn't sense a large group of them hiding and staring at me...
PC Japanese (JP): そんな大勢が、ぞろぞろと隠れていて俺をうかがっている、というような気配は、とりあえず今のところ、感じられない…。
Russian (RU): Но как я уже сказал, ощущения, будто на меня скрытно пялится уйма глаз, у меня не возникло...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ao menos, por ora, eu não podia ver...nenhum grande grupo se escondendo enquanto me observa...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 不過，總之此刻我並沒有感覺到，有這麼一大群怪物，成群結隊地躲在某處窺視著我…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 不过，总之此刻我并没有感觉到，有这么一大群怪物，成群结队地躲在某处窥视着我…。

Umineko Project (UP): What's this......?{n}Beneath the roof of the entrance, .........there's something set down.
Steam (ST): What's this...? Beneath the roof of the entrance, ......there's something set down.
PC Japanese (JP): 何だ……？玄関の屋根の下に、………何か置かれている。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 何だ……？{n}玄関の屋根の下に、………何か置かれている。
Russian (RU): Что за?..{n}Под крышей парадного входа был помещён какой‐то предмет.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O que é isso......?{n}Debaixo do alpendre da entrada, .........havia algo deixado no chão.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 什麼玩意……？{n}在大門的門廊下，………放著什麼。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 什么玩意……？{n}在大门的门廊下，………放着什么。

Speaker: Ushiromiya Battler
Steam (ST): "...What is this? ......A...box?"
PC Japanese (JP): 「……何だよ、これは。………箱…か？」
Russian (RU): "......Что это? .........Коробка?"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......O que é isso? .........Uma...caixa?"

Umineko Project (UP): It looked like the kind of small box that girls often keep trinkets in.
Steam (ST): It looked like the kind of small box that girls often keep trinkets in.
PC Japanese (JP): それは女の子なんかがよく、小物を収めていそうな感じの小箱に見えた。
Russian (RU): Коробочка, похожая на ту, где девушки держат свои украшения.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Parecia com aquele tipo de caixa pequena, onde garotas costumam guardar seus acessórios.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 那東西看起來像是個女孩子常用來裝小玩意兒的小盒子。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 那东西看起来像是个女孩子常用来装小玩意儿的小盒子。

Umineko Project (UP): ......Or maybe it was the same kind of extravagant cigar case you'd find in a reception room.
Steam (ST): ...Or maybe it was the same kind of extravagant cigar case you'd find in a reception room.
PC Japanese (JP): ……あるいは応接室なんかにある、ご大層なシガーケースの類かもしれない。
Russian (RU): Или, может, экстравагантный портсигар, который можно увидеть в приёмной роскошной гостиницы.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Ou talvez o mesmo tipo de caixa de charutos extravagante que você encontra em uma sala de recepção.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……又或許是放在會客室等場所的，高檔雪茄盒之類的東西吧。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……又或许是放在会客室等场所的，高档雪茄盒之类的东西吧。

Umineko Project (UP): Either way, it didn't look like something that belonged here...{n}It clearly looked......as though I was being told to open it.
Steam (ST): Either way, it didn't look like something that should be here... It clearly looked...as though I was being told to open it.
PC Japanese (JP): 何れにせよ、ここにあるべきものには見えない…。それはあからさまに、……俺に開けろと言われているように見えた。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 何れにせよ、ここにあるべきものには見えない…。{n}それはあからさまに、……俺に開けろと言われているように見えた。
Russian (RU): В любом случае, облик её наводил на мысль, что ей тут не место...{n}Мне делали очевидный намёк, что я должен открыть её.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Seja o que for, isso não parece com algo que pertença a esse lugar...{n}Claramente parecia fechada......como se dissesse para eu abrir.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 不管怎樣，它看起來不像是屬於這裡的東西…。{n}那看起來明顯是在，……叫我去打開它。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 不管怎样，它看起来不像是属于这里的东西…。{n}那看起来明显是在，……叫我去打开它。

Umineko Project (UP): But the thought of doing what they wanted me to do was somehow irritating.{n}......However, it didn't look like we'd get anywhere if I didn't open it.
Steam (ST): But for some reason, opening something being offered to me was irritating. ...However, it didn't look like we'd get anywhere if I didn't open it.
PC Japanese (JP): しかし、ハイどうぞと開けるのはなぜか癪に障る。……しかし、開けないことには話が進みそうもない。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): しかし、ハイどうぞと開けるのはなぜか癪に障る。{n}……しかし、開けないことには話が進みそうもない。
Russian (RU): Но по какой‐то причине этот намёк‐предложение раздражал меня.{n}Однако, судя по всему, я далеко не уеду, если всё‐таки не открою.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Mas o pensamento de fazer o que eles queriam me irritava.{n}......Entretanto, não parece que vamos chegar a lugar nenhum se eu não abrir.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 不過，去聽從“請打開”照辦，就總覺得有點窩囊了。{n}……可是，不去打開，就沒有進展。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 不过，去听从“请打开”照办，就总觉得有点窝囊了。{n}……可是，不去打开，就没有进展。

Umineko Project (UP): Could it be that it's set up with some trap to make it explode when opened......?
Steam (ST): Could it be that it's set up with some trap to make it explode when opened...?
PC Japanese (JP): まさかひょっとして、開けると爆発するような罠でも仕掛けられているのではないか……？
Russian (RU): А вдруг это ловушка, которая взорвётся, будучи открытой?
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Isso poderia ter sido colocado junto à alguma armadilha para explodir quando eu abrisse......?
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 總不會是設置了個一打開就爆炸的機關吧……？
Chinese Simplified (CN): 总不会是设置了个一打开就爆炸的机关吧……？

Umineko Project (UP): While thinking things like that, and forgetting even to go under the overhang, I continued to glare at the box as the rain beat down upon me.
Steam (ST): Thinking things like that, forgetting even to come under the overhang, I continued to glare at the box, still beaten down upon by the rain.
PC Japanese (JP): そんなことを考えながら、屋根の下に入ることも忘れ、俺は雨に打たれるまま、その小箱を睨み続けていた。
Russian (RU): Размышляя в таком ключе и даже забыв зайти под навес, я продолжал прожигать коробку взглядом, тогда как дождь, в свою очередь, от всей души проливался на меня.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Enquanto pensava coisas assim, e esquecia de ir para debaixo do alpendre, eu continuei a olhar para a caixa enquanto a chuva caia sobre mim.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 我邊如此這般地想著，邊連走進門廊都給忘了，任由雨滴拍打，目不轉睛地盯著小盒子看。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 我边如此这般地想着，边连走进门廊都给忘了，任由雨滴拍打，目不转睛地盯着小盒子看。

Umineko Project (UP): Then, .........mixed in with the thunder, was some kind of......music? ...It sounded like something like that.
Steam (ST): Then, ......mixed in with the thunder...was some kind of...music? ...It sounded like that.
PC Japanese (JP): すると、………雷鳴に混じり、何か、……音楽？　…のようなものが聞こえてきた。
Russian (RU): А затем, смешавшись с громом, раздалась какая‐то... Музыка? Да, похоже на то.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Então, .........misturado ao trovão, havia um tipo de......música? ...Era algo parecido com isso.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 接著，………我聽到了，混雜著雷鳴的，某種，……音樂？…之類的聲音。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 接着，………我听到了，混杂着雷鸣的，某种，……音乐？…之类的声音。

Umineko Project (UP): ......It was the tone of the big clock in the hall announcing midnight.
Steam (ST): ...It was the tone of the big clock in the hall announcing 24:00.
PC Japanese (JP): ……それは、２４時を報せるホールの大時計の音色。
Russian (RU): ......Это звучали большие часы в холле, обозначившие полночь.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Era o som do grande relógio no hall de entrada anunciando a chegada da meia‐noite.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……那是 24 點報時的門廳大鐘的音色。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……那是 24 点报时的门厅大钟的音色。

Umineko Project (UP): It was also the sound that announced that the crazy day of October 4th had finally ended, ......and that the much more incredibly crazy day of October 5th had begun.
Steam (ST): It was also a sound announcing that this insane day, October 4, had finally ended, ...and that the much more incredibly insane day of October 5 had begun.
PC Japanese (JP): １０月４日という、狂った一日がようやく終わりを告げ、……そして１０月５日という、もっともっと、最高に狂った一日の始まりを告げる音でもある。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): １０月４日という、おかしな一日がようやく終わりを告げ、……そして１０月５日という、もっともっと、最高にイカれた一日の始まりを告げる音でもある。
Russian (RU): Они также объявили, что безумный день — 4 октября, наконец, закончился, и на смену ему пришёл гораздо более безумный день — 5 октября.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Era também o som que anunciava que o bizarro dia 4 de outubro finalmente havia acabado, ......e que o ainda mais maluco 5 de outubro havia começado.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 此聲既告知了“10 月 4 日這瘋狂的一天，終於結束”，……也通知了“10 月 5 日，這個更加更加瘋狂的，瘋狂至極點的一天，開始了”。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 此声既告知了“10 月 4 日这疯狂的一天，终于结束”，……也通知了“10 月 5 日，这个更加更加疯狂的，疯狂至极点的一天，开始了”。

Umineko Project (UP): That sound quietened, ............and I could hear an eerie laugh coming out of nowhere......
Steam (ST): That sound quieted, ......and I could hear an eerie laugh coming out of nowhere...
PC Japanese (JP): その音が静まり、…………薄気味悪い笑い声が、どこからともなく聞こえてくる……。
Russian (RU): Звук затих... Чтобы уступить место непрятному смеху.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O barulho se aquietou, ............e eu pude ouvir uma esquisita risada vindo de algum lugar......
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 在這聲音靜下來後，…………憑空冒出的令人寒毛直豎的笑聲，鑽進了我的耳朵……。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 在这声音静下来后，…………凭空冒出的令人寒毛直竖的笑声，钻进了我的耳朵……。

Umineko Project (UP): I got the feeling that the voice was coming from the heavens, ......and I looked up at the sky.
Steam (ST): I got the feeling that the voice was coming from the heavens, ...and I looked up at the sky.
PC Japanese (JP): その声が、天より聞こえた気がして、……俺は空を見上げた。
Russian (RU): У меня возникло ощущение, что голос идет с небес, и я взглянул вверх.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eu tive a sensação de que uma voz estava vindo dos céus, ......e olhei para cima.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 這笑聲，好像是從空中傳來的，……我抬頭仰望。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 这笑声，好像是从空中传来的，……我抬头仰望。

Umineko Project (UP): ......And there.........was a woman I had never seen before.{n}No, it's not true that I've never seen her before.{n}......I saw her once today.
Steam (ST): ...What I saw there......was a woman I'd never seen before. No, it's not true that I never saw her before. ...I saw her once today.
PC Japanese (JP): ……するとそこには、………、見たことのない女が。いいや、見たことがないわけじゃない。……今日、一度見ている。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): ……するとそこには、………、見たことのない女が。{n}いいや、見たことがないわけじゃない。{n}……今日、一度見ている。
Russian (RU): ......Тем, кого я там увидел, была девушка, прежде никогда не попадавшаяся мне на глаза.{n}Нет, я вру, что никогда не видел её ранее.{n}......Мне довелось увидеть её сегодня.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......E lá.........estava uma mulher na qual eu nunca havia visto.{n}Não, não é verdade que eu nunca a vi antes.{n}......Eu a vi hoje.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……在那的是一位，………我從沒見過的女子。{n}不、不是從沒見過。{n}……今天，見過一次。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……在那的是一位，………我从没见过的女子。{n}不、不是从没见过。{n}……今天，见过一次。

Umineko Project (UP): Yes, in the portrait inside the mansion......
Steam (ST): Yes, in the portrait inside the mansion...
PC Japanese (JP): そう、屋敷の中での、肖像画で……。
Russian (RU): Да, я видел её на портрете в особняке...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Sim, no retrato da mansão......
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 對，在大屋中的肖像畫上見過……。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 对，在大屋中的肖像画上见过……。

Umineko Project (UP): The clothes were different, ......but that face was just like the witch of the portrait......
Steam (ST): The clothes were different, ...but that face was just like the witch of the portrait...
PC Japanese (JP): 服は違うが、……その顔は、あの肖像画の魔女にそっくり……。
Russian (RU): Одежда другая, но вот лицо точно такое же, как и у ведьмы на портрете...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): As roupas eram diferentes, ......mas o rosto era igual o da bruxa do retrato......
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 雖然服裝不同，……但那張臉，與肖像畫上的魔女一模一樣……。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 虽然服装不同，……但那张脸，与肖像画上的魔女一模一样……。

Umineko Project (UP): Aaah, who am I kidding... I already know who this person is...!!
Steam (ST): Aaah, who am I kidding, ...I already know who this person is...!!
PC Japanese (JP): あぁ、白々しいぜ、俺はヤツが誰か、もうわかってる…！！
Russian (RU): А‐а‐ах, кого я обманываю... Я знаю, кто это!
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Aaah, quem eu estou enganando... eu já sei quem ela é...!!
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 啊啊，別裝傻了，我知道她是誰…！！
Chinese Simplified (CN): 啊啊，别装傻了，我知道她是谁…！！

Speaker: Ushiromiya Battler
Umineko Project (UP): "......S‐......so you are {f:5:Beatrice}!!!"
Steam (ST): "...A-Are you {f:5:Beatrice}?!!!"
PC Japanese (JP): 「……て、……てめえがベアトリーチェかッ！！！」
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......E‐......Então você é a {f:5:Beatrice}!!!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……你、……你就是貝阿朵莉切嗎？！！！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……你、……你就是贝阿朵莉切吗？！！！」

Speaker: {f:5:Beatrice}
Umineko Project (UP): "Yooohooooooooo, Battleeeeeeeeeeeeer...!!"
Steam (ST): "Yahhoooooooooi, Battleeeeeeeeeeeeer...!!"
PC Japanese (JP): 「やっほおおぉおい、戦人ぁあああぁあああぁああぁ…！！」
Russian (RU): "Эге‐ей, Баттле‐е‐е‐е‐ер!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Yahhoooooooooi, Battleeeeeeeeeeeeer...!!"

Umineko Project (UP): Leaning over the second floor balcony, ......and waving cheerily from under her umbrella, ......was, without a doubt, ......the witch of the portrait, ...{f:5:Beatrice}.........!!
Steam (ST): From the second floor balcony, ...leaning out under an umbrella and waving high-spiritedly, ...was, without a doubt, the witch of the portrait, ...{f:5:Beatrice}......!!
PC Japanese (JP): ２階のバルコニーから、……傘を差しながら身を乗り出し上機嫌に手を振っているのは、……紛れもなく、……肖像画の魔女、…ベアトリーチェ………！！
Russian (RU): Свесившись с балкона второго этажа, высунувшись из‐под зонтика, мне, вне всяких сомнений... воодушевлённо махала... ведьма с портрета — {f:5:Беатриче}!
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Apoiada na sacada do segundo andar, ......acenando animada debaixo de um guarda‐chuva, ......estava, sem dúvida, ......a bruxa do retrato, ...{f:5:Beatrice}.........!!
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 從二樓陽台上，……撐著傘，探出上半身，興高采烈揮著手的傢伙，……的的確確就是，……肖像畫上的魔女，…貝阿朵莉切………！！
Chinese Simplified (CN): 从二楼阳台上，……撑着伞，探出上半身，兴高采烈挥着手的家伙，……的的确确就是，……肖像画上的魔女，…贝阿朵莉切………！！

Umineko Project (UP): Was the plan for the boss to watch on from above as her goat underlings torture me to death...?!
Steam (ST): Was the plan for the boss to take a birds-eye view and let the goat underlings torture me to death...?!
PC Japanese (JP): 親玉は高みの見物で、俺は山羊の手下どもに嬲り殺しって寸法か…？！
Russian (RU): Неужели она собирается наблюдать с высоты, отдав приказ козлоголовым шестёркам запытать меня до смерти?!
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Seria parte do plano do chefão observar seus subordinados cabras me torturarem até a morte...?!
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 這是盤算著，老大作壁上觀，要看著我被其山羊手下們活活玩死嗎…？！
Chinese Simplified (CN): 这是盘算着，老大作壁上观，要看着我被其山羊手下们活活玩死吗…？！

Umineko Project (UP): I adjusted my grip on the spear, and, imagining goats creeping out of the surrounding shadows and the entrance and surrounding me, I raised my guard in all directions...
Steam (ST): I adjusted my grip on the spear, and, imagining goats creeping out of the nearby shadows and the entrance and surrounding me, I raised my guard in all directions...
PC Japanese (JP): 俺は槍を構え直し、周囲の物陰や玄関の扉から、どどっと山羊どもが溢れ出して俺を取り囲むのを想像しながら、全方向に身構えた…。
Russian (RU): Поудобнее перехватив своё копьё и представив этих козлов, вылезающих из окружающих теней и входа и окружающих меня, я приготовился к атаке...

Umineko Project (UP): I had pretty much fully responded to her provocation, and I was sure that I'd vented out all the stuff that I'd been keeping inside my chest, stuff I hadn't wanted to show anyone.
Steam (ST): Part of me had fully responded to her provocation, and I'd supposedly vented out all the stuff I'd kept inside my chest, stuff I hadn't wanted to show anyone.
PC Japanese (JP): 俺は、半ばヤツの挑発に完全に乗り、胸の内の、誰にも見せたくなかった部分を、全て吐き出してしまったはずだ。
Russian (RU): Часть меня полностью ответила на её провокацию и, предположительно, я выпустил всю ту дрянь, которую держал в груди, мусор, который я не хотел никому показывать.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eu havia respondido à altura das provocação dela, e tinha certeza que eu havia liberado todas as coisas que eu mantinha presas dentro do meu peito, coisas que eu não queria mostrar a ninguém.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 我應該是說到一半，就完全跟著她的挑釁走，把藏在心中的不想給任何人看到之物全都傾吐出來了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 我应该是说到一半，就完全跟着她的挑衅走，把藏在心中的不想给任何人看到之物全都倾吐出来了。

Umineko Project (UP): That was what the witch had supposedly been hoping for, too. ......And yet, the witch's blank expression didn't change in the slightest.
Steam (ST): That was what the witch had supposedly been expecting. ...And yet, the witch's blank expression didn't change in the slightest.
PC Japanese (JP): 魔女も、それを期待していたはず。……なのに、魔女は淡白な表情をわずかほども変えることはない。

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Provavelmente era isso que a bruxa supostamente estava esperando. ......E ainda assim, a face sem expressão da bruxa não mudou absolutamente nada.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 魔女應該也是在期待著此。……可是，魔女那淡漠的神情沒有絲毫改變。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 魔女应该也是在期待着此。……可是，魔女那淡漠的神情没有丝毫改变。

Umineko Project (UP): I had been sure she would start cackling and guffawing, sneering at my childish, foolish, and shameful past.
Steam (ST): I'd been sure she'd start cackling and guffawing, sneering at my childish, foolish, and shameful past.
PC Japanese (JP): 俺の、幼稚で愚かしく、情けない過去を、げらげらへらへらと、嘲笑うに違いないと思っていた。
Russian (RU): Я был уверен, что она начнёт хихикать и хохотать, развеселённая моим детским, глупым и позорным прошлым.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eu tinha certeza que ela começaria a rir e gargalhar, zombando da minha infantilidade, tolice e passado vergonhoso.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 我本以為，她肯定會哈哈哈嚇嚇嚇地嘲笑，我幼稚愚蠢可恥的過去。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 我本以为，她肯定会哈哈哈吓吓吓地嘲笑，我幼稚愚蠢可耻的过去。

Umineko Project (UP): But to the contrary, I could feel a sense of shock about her, ......something you could almost call disappointment.
Steam (ST): But to the contrary, I could feel a sense of disgust about her, ...something you could almost call disappointment.
PC Japanese (JP): なのにそれどころか、まるで期待外れだとでも言うような、……そんな呆れさえ感じられた。
Russian (RU): Напротив, у меня сложилось впечатление, что я шокировал её... Или, что правильнее, разочаровал.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Mas, pelo contrário, eu consegui sentir uma espécie de desgosto vindo dela, ......algo que você poderia até chamar de desapontamento.

Chinese Simplified (CN): 可是，她岂止没这么做，在其脸上，甚至还感到了一丝如同在说“期望落空了”的，……失望之情。

Umineko Project (UP): The witch who had questioned Battler hid herself, and the other witch, who had appeared from behind, remained.
Steam (ST): The witch who had questioned Battler hid herself, and the other witch, who had appeared from behind, remained.

Russian (RU): Ведьма, которая допрашивала Баттлера, исчезла, а другая ведьма, возникшая позади неё, осталась.

Chinese Simplified (CN): 之前质问战人的魔女消去身形，留下的是，之后现身的另一位魔女。

Umineko Project (UP): She was certainly identical, the same witch, .........but her expression was somehow indifferent and ice‐cold, ......a far cry from the one before, who, though apparently drunk, had at least been in high spirits.
Steam (ST): She certainly was identical, the same witch, ......but her expression was somehow indifferent and ice-cold, ...completely removed from the one who, despite seeming drunk up until then, had been in high spirits.
PC Japanese (JP): 確かに瓜二つの、同じ魔女だったが、………その表情はどこかとても淡白で冷め切っていて、……それまでの悪酔いした風とはいえ、元気のよかった彼女からはかけ離れていた。
Russian (RU): Она была точно такой же, идентичной ведьмой... но выражение её лица было каким‐то равнодушным, ледяным... Она полностью отличалась от той, которая, несмотря на кажущееся опьянение перед этим, была в приподнятом настроении.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ela era certamente idêntica, a mesma bruxa, .........mas a expressão em seu rosto era indiferente, fria como gelo, ......completamente diferente da anterior, que apesar de aparentemente bêbada, estava animada.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 雖的確是一模一樣的，同一個魔女，………但其表情非常淡然冷漠，……與之前的雖說是耍酒瘋，但也可謂精神十足的她相去甚遠。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 虽的确是一模一样的，同一个魔女，………但其表情非常淡然冷漠，……与之前的虽说是耍酒疯，但也可谓精神十足的她相去甚远。

Speaker: Ushiromiya Battler
Umineko Project (UP): "...............Hey!! Are you listening?! That's enough for that test thing, right?! I don't give a crap whether I passed or failed! The only thing that's gonna help the way I'm feeling is bashing you in the face!! Get the hell down here!! Or else open up this door...!!"
Steam (ST): "......Hey!! Are you listening?! Isn't this enough for that test thing?! I don't care whether I passed or failed! I won't be satisfied until I can bash your face!! Come down here!! Or else open this door...!!"
PC Japanese (JP): 「……………おいッ！！　聞いてるのかッ？！　テストとやらはもう充分だろう？！　合格だろうと不合格だろうと、どうでもいいぜ！　お前の横っ面をブン殴ってやらなきゃ気が済まねぇ！！　降りてきやがれ！！　さもなきゃここの扉を開けやがれ…！！」
Russian (RU): "............Эй! Ты слушаешь?! Разве этого не достаточно для теста?! Меня не волнует, прошёл я, или нет! Я не удовлетворюсь, пока не смогу разбить тебе лицо! Спускайся! Или открой дверь!.."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "...............Ei!! Você está ouvindo?! Já é o bastante para o teste, certo?! Eu não me importo se passei ou não! A única coisa que vai satisfazer meus sentimentos é dar um soco na sua cara!! Desça aqui!! Ou eu vou abrir essa porta...!!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……………喂！！有在聽嗎？！叫考試的玩意，已經玩夠了吧？！合格不合格，我全都無所謂！不痛揍下你的臉，我就咽不下這口氣！！給我下來！！要不然，就給我把這門打開…！！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……………喂！！有在听吗？！叫考试的玩意，已经玩够了吧？！合格不合格，我全都无所谓！不痛揍下你的脸，我就咽不下这口气！！给我下来！！要不然，就给我把这门打开…！！」

Umineko Project (UP): The witch said nothing back.

Chinese Simplified (CN): 魔女什么都没有回答。

Steam (ST): Her eyes were as ice-cold as Battler's shoulders.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Kinzo
Umineko Project (UP): "Maria's test got passing marks with no complaints, I'll have you know? I've long held her in contempt as a worthless little urchin, but lo and behold, surprise surprise, {nobr:my oh} {nobr:my oh} {nobr:my oh} my, not bad, not bad, not bad indeed! Wa‐hah‐hah‐hah‐hah‐hah!!"
Steam (ST): Maria's test got passing marks with no complaints, you see? I've despised her as a little girl, little girl, but see, but see, why, why, oh my, oh my, not bad, not bad! Wahhahhahhahhahha!!"
PC Japanese (JP): 真里亞のテストは文句なしに合格点であったぞ？　あやつを小娘小娘と、わしは長いこと侮っていたが、これはこれはどうしてどうして、いやはやいやはやなかなかなかなか！　わっはっはっはっはっは！！」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「真里亞のテストは文句なしに合格点であったぞ？　あやつを小娘小娘と、わしは長いこと侮っていたが、これはこれはどうしてどうして、いやはやいやはやなかなかなかなか！　わっはっはっはっはっは！！」
Russian (RU): "Мария прошла тест без ошибок, веришь? Я презирал её, как малявку, малявку, но видишь, видишь ли, почему, почему, боже мой, боже мой, не плохо, не плохо! Ва‐ха‐ха‐ха‐ха‐ха!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "A Maria passou no teste dela de forma indiscutível, sabia? Por muito tempo eu a desprezei como se fosse uma mísera garotinha sem valor, mas, eis que surpresa, que surpresa, {nobr:ora}, {nobr:ora}, {nobr:ora}, nada mau, nada mau, de fato nada mau! Wa‐hah‐hah‐hah‐hah‐hah!!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「真里亞的考試，可是得了挑不出毛病的合格分哦？雖然我長年將她輕視為小女孩，但這可真是何故何故，哎呀啊呀哎呀啊呀相當相當！哇哈哈哈哈哈！！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「真里亚的考试，可是得了挑不出毛病的合格分哦？虽然我长年将她轻视为小女孩，但这可真是何故何故，哎呀啊呀哎呀啊呀相当相当！哇哈哈哈哈哈！！」

Umineko Project (UP): It seemed like Kinzo was dead drunk.{n}He laughed towards Beato with the same level of excitation as the time they'd left for the tests.
Steam (ST): It seemed like Kinzo was dead drunk. Facing Beato, who had returned, he laughed with the same level of tension as the time they'd left for the tests.
PC Japanese (JP): どうやら、金蔵もすっかり出来上がっているようだった。戻ってきたベアトに対し、テストに出掛けて行った時と同じテンションで笑い掛ける。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): どうやら、金蔵もすっかり出来上がっているようだった。{n}戻ってきたベアトに対し、テストに出掛けて行った時と同じテンションで笑い掛ける。
Russian (RU): Казалось, Кинзо был мертвецки пьян.{n}Повернувшись к вернувшейся Беато, он рассмеялся с тем же напряжением, как и тогда, когда они уходили проводить испытания.

Chinese Traditional (CHT): 噶普也表情凝固，不再說話。

Speaker: Ushiromiya Kinzo
Umineko Project (UP): "Wahhahahahahahhahha, what is it, {f:5:Beatrice}, my beloved witch? Not enough to drink? Not enough on the side? Let's go out in the pouring rain and roast a cow whole, oohhh, not a bad idea!"
Steam (ST): "Wahhahahahahahhahha, what is it, {f:5:Beatrice}, my beloved witch? Not enough to drink? Not enough on the side? Let's pour it all over a cow or something and roast it whole, ooh, not bad!"
PC Japanese (JP): 「わっはははははっはっは、どうしたベアトリーチェよ、我が最愛の魔女よ。酒が足りぬか？肴が足りぬか？　土砂降りを浴びながら牛でも丸焼きにしようか、おお、悪くないッ！
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「わっはははははっはっは、どうしたベアトリーチェよ、我が最愛の魔女よ。酒が足りぬか？　肴が足りぬか？　土砂降りを浴びながら牛でも丸焼きにしようか、おお、悪くないッ！」
Russian (RU): "Ва‐ха‐ха‐ха‐ха‐ха‐ха‐ха, что такое, {f:5:Беатриче}, моя возлюбленная ведьма? Недостаточно напитков? Недостаточно почтения? Давай возьмём корову, или ещё что‐нибудь, и зажарим целиком, о‐о, неплохо!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Wahhahahahahahhahha, o que foi, {f:5:Beatrice}, minha amada bruxa? Não bebeu o bastante? Ainda não se satisfez? Vamos sair no meio da chuva e assar uma vaca, oohhh, não é uma má ideia!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「哇、哈哈哈哈哈、哈、哈，怎麼了，貝阿朵莉切喲，吾最愛的魔女喲。是酒不夠嗎？菜不夠嗎？要不就去沐浴在暴雨中烤全牛吧，哦——，不壞不壞！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「哇、哈哈哈哈哈、哈、哈，怎么了，贝阿朵莉切哟，吾最爱的魔女哟。是酒不够吗？菜不够吗？要不就去沐浴在暴雨中烤全牛吧，哦——，不坏不坏！」

Speaker: Ushiromiya Kinzo
Umineko Project (UP): "Ronove, make the preparations right away! {f:5:Beatrice}, let's leave the results of Battler's test for later. Why don't we have a toast with spare ribs first, uwa‐hah‐hah‐hah‐hah‐hah!!"

PC Japanese (JP): ロノウェ、さっそく準備をせよ！　ベアトリーチェよ、戦人のテスト結果は後だ。まずはスペアリブで乾杯と行こうではないか、うわっはっはっはっはっはっはッ！！」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「ロノウェ、さっそく準備をせよ！　ベアトリーチェよ、戦人のテスト結果は後だ。まずはスペアリブで乾杯と行こうではないか、うわっはっはっはっはっはっはッ！！」
Russian (RU): "Ронове, сейчас же приготовь одну! {f:5:Беатриче}, давай оставим результаты испытания Баттлера на потом. Почему бы нам сначала не приготовить тост с рёбрышками, ува‐ха‐ха‐ха‐ха‐ха!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Ronove, faça os preparativos agora mesmo! {f:5:Beatrice}, vamos deixar os resultados do teste do Battler para depois. Por que não fazemos um brinde junto com umas costelinhas, uwa‐hah‐hah‐hah‐hah‐hah!!"

Chinese Simplified (CN): 「罗诺威，速速去准备！贝阿朵莉切哟，战人的考试结果等下再说。先来就猪排干杯吧，哇哈哈哈哈哈哈！！」

Umineko Project (UP): As Kinzo doubled over laughing in a great mood, the witch who had spoken bluntly passed him coldly by.
Steam (ST): The witch, who had spoken bluntly, coldly passed by Kinzo's side as he doubled over laughing in a great mood.
PC Japanese (JP): 素っ気無く言い放った魔女は、上機嫌に笑い転げている金蔵の脇を、冷たく通り過ぎる。
Russian (RU): Резко ответившая ведьма холодно миновала Кинзо, согнувшегося от смеха и пребывающего в отличном настроении.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Enquanto Kinzo ria duplamente de bom humor, a bruxa, que falou abruptamente, passou por ele friamente.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 冷冰冰地放下這句話的魔女從興高采烈哈哈大笑的金藏身邊漠然走過。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 冷冰冰地放下这句话的魔女从兴高采烈哈哈大笑的金藏身边漠然走过。

Umineko Project (UP): ......Then, behind the witch's back, .........the old summoner's body suddenly went up in flames...
Steam (ST): ...Then, behind the witch's back, ......the old summoner's body suddenly went up in flames...
PC Japanese (JP): ……すると魔女の背後で、………老いた召喚師の体が突如、燃え上がった…。
Russian (RU): ......Затем позади ведьмы... тело старого призывателя вдруг загорелось...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Então, atrás das costas da bruxa, .........o corpo do velho invocado se incendiou...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……接著，在魔女的身後，………老召喚師的身體突然熊熊燃燒了起來…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……接着，在魔女的身后，………老召唤师的身体突然熊熊燃烧了起来…。

Speaker: Ushiromiya Kinzo
Umineko Project (UP): "Gyuoaaaaooaahhh!!!! Gwohh, gah, ......gyah.........w...h...y............?!"
Steam (ST): "Gyaaaaaahhh!!!! Gwohh, gah, ...gyah, ......w...h...y......?!"
PC Japanese (JP): 「ぎゅおおおぉッ！！！！　ぐお、が、……ぎゃ………、な、ぜ、か…………ッ？！」
Russian (RU): "Гья‐а‐а‐а‐а‐а! Гво‐о, га... гья... по‐че‐му?!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Gyuoaaaaooaahhh!!!! Gwohh, gah, ......gyah.........p...o...r...q...u...e.....?!"

Umineko Project (UP): While spitting crimson flames from his eyes, mouth, nose...every hole on his body, Kinzo rolled around.
Steam (ST): As crimson flames spat from his eyes, mouth, nose, ...every hole on his body, Kinzo rolled around.
PC Japanese (JP): 目、口、鼻などの全身のあらゆる穴から紅蓮の炎を噴出しながら、金蔵は転げ回る。
Russian (RU): Тёмно‐красное пламя полилось из его глаз, рта, носа... из каждой дырочки его тела. Кинзо завертелся.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Enquanto cuspia chamas carmesins por seus olhos, boca, nariz...por cada orifício de seu corpo, Kinzo rolou de um lado para o outro.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 金藏邊從眼、口、鼻等全身所有的洞中噴出紅蓮之火，邊倒下身去。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 金藏边从眼、口、鼻等全身所有的洞中喷出红莲之火，边倒下身去。

Umineko Project (UP): ......Even though it was a terrible hellfire, it didn't burn anything except Kinzo.
Steam (ST): ...Even though it was a terrible hellfire, it didn't burn anything except Kinzo.
PC Japanese (JP): ……それは恐ろしい業火であるにもかかわらず、金蔵以外の何物も焦がすことはなかった。
Russian (RU): ......Даже несмотря на то, что это было ужасное адское пламя, оно не жгло ничего, кроме Кинзо.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Mesmo sendo um terrível fogo infernal, ele não queimou nada mais além de Kinzo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……儘管這是可怕的業火，但卻又並未灼燒到除金藏外的任何東西。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……尽管这是可怕的业火，但却又并未灼烧到除金藏外的任何东西。

Umineko Project (UP): Kinzo didn't have a clue what was going on.
Steam (ST): Kinzo didn't have a clue what was going on.
PC Japanese (JP): 金蔵は何が何やらわからない。
Russian (RU): Кинзо понятия не имел, что произошло.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Kinzo não fazia ideia do que estava acontecendo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 金藏一點都不明白。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 金藏一点都不明白。

Umineko Project (UP): ......He rolled around, unable to understand why {f:5:Beatrice}, who had been in such a good mood, had suddenly turned so cold......
Steam (ST): ...Unable to understand why {f:5:Beatrice}, who had been in such a good mood, had suddenly turned so cold, he rolled around...
PC Japanese (JP): ……あれほど上機嫌だったベアトリーチェが突然に、なぜにこれほど冷酷になったのか理解できず、転げ回る……。
Russian (RU): ......Он катался по полу, не в силах понять, почему {f:5:Беатриче}, до этого пребывающая в таком хорошем настроении, внезапно стала так холодна...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Rolando de um lado ao outro, incapaz de entender o motivo pelo qual {f:5:Beatrice}, que estava de bom humor, de repente ficou tão fria......
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……滿地打滾的他無法理解，剛才還那麼高興的貝阿朵莉切，為什麼會突然變得這般冷酷……。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……满地打滚的他无法理解，刚才还那么高兴的贝阿朵莉切，为什么会突然变得这般冷酷……。

Umineko Project (UP): The dancing silhouettes of witches and demons created by that massive rolling torch...looked like a group of excited spectators around a burning at the stake.
Steam (ST): The dancing silhouettes of the witch and demons created by that massive rolling torch... looked like a group of excited spectators around a burning at the stake.
PC Japanese (JP): その転げ回る巨大な松明が生み出す、魔女と悪魔たちの踊るような影絵は、その火炙り刑に興奮する観衆にも見えた。
Russian (RU): Силуэты ведьмы и демонов, сотканные этим огромным катающимся факелом, напоминали толпу воодушевлённых зрителей вокруг сожжения на костре.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): As silhuetas dançantes das bruxas e demônios criadas pela grande tocha rolante...se assemelhavam a um grupo de espectadores, excitados ao redor de uma estaca posta na fogueira.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 翻滾的巨大火焰所照出的，魔女惡魔們的爭相舞蹈的剪影，看著簡直就像是因火刑而興奮的觀眾。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 翻滚的巨大火焰所照出的，魔女恶魔们的争相舞蹈的剪影，看着简直就像是因火刑而兴奋的观众。

Umineko Project (UP): However, the eyes of the demons watching over it were indifferent......
Steam (ST): However, the eyes of the demons who watched over it were indifferent...
PC Japanese (JP): しかし、それを見守る悪魔たちの瞳は冷ややかなものだった……。
Russian (RU): Однако в глазах демонов, наблюдавших за этим, читалось равнодушие...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Entretanto, os olhos dos demônios que observavam eram indiferentes......
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 然而，看著這副情景的惡魔們的瞳孔冰冷漠然……。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 然而，看着这副情景的恶魔们的瞳孔冰冷漠然……。

Umineko Project (UP): When Kinzo finally stopped moving, the fire disappeared, leaving a pitch‐black corpse.
Steam (ST): When Kinzo finally stopped moving, the fire disappeared, leaving a pitch-black corpse.
PC Japanese (JP): やがて金蔵が動かなくなると、火は消え、そこには真っ黒な死体が残る。
Russian (RU): Когда Кинзо наконец остановился, огонь погас, явив чёрный, как смоль, труп.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Quando Kinzo finalmente parou de se mover, o fogo desapareceu, deixando um cadáver adusto.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 過了一會兒，在金藏不再動彈後，火焰熄滅，地上留下了一具全身焦黑的屍體。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 过了一会儿，在金藏不再动弹后，火焰熄灭，地上留下了一具全身焦黑的尸体。

Umineko Project (UP): The inside of the room was commanded by the stillness of the sound of the rain......
Steam (ST): The inside of the room was commanded by the stillness of the sound of the rain...
PC Japanese (JP): 室内は静寂という名の、雨音に支配されるのだった……。
Russian (RU): В комнате воцарилось безмолвие, смешанное со звуком дождя...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O interior do quarto era agora ditado pela quietude do som da chuva......
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 室內被名為寂靜的雨聲所支配……。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 室内被名为寂静的雨声所支配……。

Umineko Project (UP): "......What has happened, Milady?"
Steam (ST): "...What has happened, Milady?"

Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……怎么了，小姐？」

Umineko Project (UP): "It has lost its thrill. .........Clean up those bothersome cinders."
Steam (ST): "I've gotten over...my excitement. ......Clean up those bothersome cinders."

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「興が、醒めた。………その邪魔な燃えカスを片付けよ」
Russian (RU): "Я усмирила... своё волнение. .........Убери этот надоедливый пепел."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Perdeu‐se a emoção. .........Limpe essas incômodas cinzas."

Steam (ST): {f:5:Beatrice}'s expression...was unbelievably indifferent.

Russian (RU): Лицо {f:5:Беатриче}... было невероятно равнодушным.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): A expressão de {f:5:Beatrice}......estava inacreditavelmente apática.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 貝阿朵莉切的表情，……冷漠到了難以置信的地步。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 贝阿朵莉切的表情，……冷漠到了难以置信的地步。

Umineko Project (UP): ...There was an iciness there that told the others that they risked the same fate as Kinzo if they annoyed her.
Steam (ST): ...There was an iciness that might easily bring the others to the same fate as Kinzo if they annoyed her.
PC Japanese (JP): …機嫌を損ねれば、自分たちも金蔵と同じ末路を辿らされかねない冷たさがあった。
Russian (RU): В нём чувствовался лёд, способный заставить остальных разделить судьбу Кинзо, если они вызовут у неё хоть капельку раздражения.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Havia uma frieza que dizia aos outros que eles corriam o risco de terem o mesmo destino de Kinzo se a perturbassem.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …其中帶有著一份，若是惹她不高興，自己等人也有可能走上與金藏相同末路的冷酷。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …其中带有着一份，若是惹她不高兴，自己等人也有可能走上与金藏相同末路的冷酷。

Speaker: Gaap
Umineko Project (UP): "............Y‐yes. I will do it..."
Steam (ST): "......Y-Yes. I will clean it up..."

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "............S‐Sim. Eu farei isso..."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「…………好、好。我來收拾…」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「…………好、好。我来收拾…」

Umineko Project (UP): Gaap made a jet‐black pitfall swallow up Kinzo's cinders.
Steam (ST): Gaap made a jet-black pitfall swallow up Kinzo's cinders.
PC Japanese (JP): ガァプは漆黒の落とし穴に金蔵の燃えカスを飲み込ませる。
Russian (RU): Гаап создала чёрные дыры, поглотившие пепел Кинзо.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Gaap criou um poço negro que engoliu as cinzas de Kinzo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 噶普以漆黑的落穴吞下了金藏留下的焦炭。
Chinese Simplified (CN): [=CHT]

Umineko Project (UP): ...If she hadn't carried that out quickly, Gaap might also have been burned. You could feel that thirst for blood.
Steam (ST): ...If she hadn't carried that out quickly, Gaap might also have been burned. You could even feel that thirst for blood.
PC Japanese (JP): …それを早く実行しなければ、ガァプもまた燃やされるかもしれない。そんな殺気さえ感じた。
Russian (RU): ...Если бы Гаап быстрее не позаботилась об этом, то тоже могла сгореть. Жажда крови ощущалась почти физически.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Se ela não tivesse feito aquilo rapidamente, Gaap também poderia acabar sendo queimada. Dava para sentir aquela sede por sangue.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …若是沒有速速實行，噶普說不定也會被燒死。這氣氛，甚至令人感到了這種殺氣。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …若是没有速速实行，噶普说不定也会被烧死。这气氛，甚至令人感到了这种杀气。

Umineko Project (UP): No, a thirst for blood probably isn't the best way to describe it.
Steam (ST): No, a thirst for blood probably isn't the best way to describe it.
PC Japanese (JP): いや、殺気という表現さえ妥当ではない。
Russian (RU): Нет, "жажда крови" — вероятно, не самые подходящие слова, чтобы описать это.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Não, uma sede por sangue provavelmente não é a melhor forma de descrever.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 不，就連殺氣這個比喻都並不恰當。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 不，就连杀气这个比喻都并不恰当。

Umineko Project (UP): ......Just like humans don't have any particular emotion when they step on an ant while walking.
Steam (ST): ...Just like humans don't have any particular emotion when they step on an ant while they're walking...
PC Japanese (JP): ……人が歩く時、アリを踏み潰すことに特別な感情など抱かないように。
Russian (RU): Так бесстрастно люди при ходьбе наступают на муравья.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Assim como humanos não possuem nenhuma emoção particular quando pisam em uma formiga enquanto caminham.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……就跟人走路時，不會對踩死的螞蟻抱有特別的感情一樣。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……就跟人走路时，不会对踩死的蚂蚁抱有特别的感情一样。

Umineko Project (UP): ......That was how much, unconsciously and mercilessly, Beato was now filled with a brutal emptiness that wouldn't hesitate to bury a passerby...
Steam (ST): ...That was how much, unconsciously and mercilessly, Beato was now filled with a brutal emptiness that wouldn't hesitate at burying a passerby...
PC Japanese (JP): ……それくらい、無意識に無慈悲に、今のベアトには行きずりの何者かを葬りかねない残忍なる空虚さで満ちていた…。
Russian (RU): ......Сейчас Беато была наполнена жестокой пустотой, такой бессознательной и беспощадной, что без колебаний похоронила бы любого...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Era assim que, inconscientemente e impiedosamente, Beato estava agora, preenchida por um vazio brutal que não hesitaria em enterrar um transeunte...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……在此刻的貝阿朵身上，充滿了會毫不留情無意識地將迎面走過的某人送去見閻王的，殘忍的空虛…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……在此刻的贝阿朵身上，充满了会毫不留情无意识地将迎面走过的某人送去见阎王的，残忍的空虚…。

Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……怎、怎么了，贝阿朵？」

Umineko Project (UP): "I don't want to answer. ...............No, I can't even be bothered to answer any more."

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「答えたくない。……………いや、答えるのも、もはや面倒臭い」

Chinese Simplified (CN): 「不想回答。……………不，是就连答，都懒得答了。」

Umineko Project (UP): ".........What is it? This isn't like you. ......Did something happen? Did Battler say someth—"
Steam (ST): "...What is it? This isn't like you. ...Did something happen? Did Battler say someth-

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「………どうしたのよ、らしくもなく。……何かあったの？　戦人が何か言っ、」

Umineko Project (UP): {f:5:Beatrice} hadn't even responded. It seemed that she had even ignored it.
Steam (ST): {f:5:Beatrice} didn't even answer. It seemed that she even ignored it.
PC Japanese (JP): ベアトリーチェは、返事もしていない。無視さえしたはずだ。
Russian (RU): {f:5:Беатриче} даже не ответила. Казалось, она проигнорировала её.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): {f:5:Beatrice} sequer respondeu. Pareceu até que ela havia ignorado.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 貝阿朵莉切沒有反應。她應該是予以了無視。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 贝阿朵莉切没有反应。她应该是予以了无视。

Umineko Project (UP): But there was a change in Gaap.
Steam (ST): But there was a change in Gaap.
PC Japanese (JP): しかし、ガァプに変化が起こる。
Russian (RU): Но Гаап изменилась.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Mas havia uma mudança em Gaap.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 可是，噶普卻發生了變化。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 可是，噶普却发生了变化。

Umineko Project (UP): From her feet, a crackling, cracking sound rose, like thin ice breaking, ......and in an instant, turned Gaap into a glass sculpture.
Steam (ST): From her feet, a creaking, cracking sound rose, like thin ice breaking, ...and in an instant, turned Gaap into a glass sculpture.
PC Japanese (JP): 足元から、メリメリパキパキと、薄氷を割るような音が上り、……瞬く間に、ガァプをガラスの彫像に変えてしまう。
Russian (RU): Из‐под её ног раздался скрипящий, трескучий звук, как будто сломался лёд... и Гаап мгновенно превратилась в стеклянную скульптуру.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): De seu pé, um crepitante som se elevou, como um fino gelo quebrando e, ......instantaneamente, transformou Gaap em uma escultura de vidro.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 從其雙腳由下往上地發出了，嘎嚓嘎嚓，猶如薄冰開裂的聲音，……貝阿朵莉切在轉瞬之間，就將噶普變成了玻璃雕像。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 从其双脚由下往上地发出了，嘎嚓嘎嚓，犹如薄冰开裂的声音，……贝阿朵莉切在转瞬之间，就将噶普变成了玻璃雕像。

Speaker: {f:5:Beatrice}
Umineko Project (UP): "............Disappear for a while. I'm in a very bad mood."
Steam (ST): "......Disappear for a while. I'm in a very bad mood."
PC Japanese (JP): 「…………しばらく、消えろ。大変に不機嫌だ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「…………しばらく、消えろ。大変に不機嫌だ」
Russian (RU): ".........Исчезните ненадолго. У меня очень плохое настроение."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "............Desapareça por ora. Eu estou de mau humor."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「…………暫且消去身形。妾身非常地不高興。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「…………暂且消去身形。妾身非常地不高兴。」

Umineko Project (UP): {f:5:Beatrice} spoke in a truly cold voice, ......which froze the heart just to hear it.
Steam (ST): {f:5:Beatrice} spoke that... in a truly cold voice, which could freeze the heart just by hearing it.
PC Japanese (JP): ベアトリーチェは、本当に冷たい、……聞くだけで心までも凍えさせてしまうような声で、そう言い放った。
Russian (RU): {f:5:Беатриче} сказала это... по‐настоящему холодным голосом, способным заморозить сердце, едва коснувшись ушей.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): {f:5:Beatrice} falou com um tom de voz frígido, ......capaz de congelar o coração ao ser ouvido.

Chinese Simplified (CN): 贝阿朵莉切，以真的十分冰冷的，……光是听着就令人感到寒冷到心都要冻僵了的声音，如此说道。

Speaker: Ronove
Umineko Project (UP): "......Certainly. In that case, please allow us to retire. .........If you need anything, call at any time."
Steam (ST): "...Certainly. Then, please allow us to retire. ......If you need anything, call at any time."
PC Japanese (JP): 「……かしこまりました。それでは私どもは、これでお暇させていただきます。………何かございましたら、いつでもお呼びを。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……かしこまりました。それでは私どもは、これでお暇させていただきます。………何かございましたら、いつでもお呼びを」
Russian (RU): "......Конечно. Тогда позвольте нам удалиться. .........Если Вам что‐нибудь понадобится, зовите в любое время."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Certamente. Neste caso, permita‐nos nos retirarmos. .........Se precisar de alguma coisa, chame‐me a qualquer hora."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……遵命。那麼，我們就此領受閑暇了。………如有什麼事的話，請隨時吩咐。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……遵命。那么，我们就此领受闲暇了。………如有什么事的话，请随时吩咐。」

Umineko Project (UP): After a single bow, Ronove turned into a cloud of gold butterflies, and hid himself.
Steam (ST): After bowing, Ronove turned into a cloud of gold butterflies and hid himself.
PC Japanese (JP): ロノウェは一礼してから、黄金の蝶の群に変わり、姿を消す。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): ロノウェは一礼してから、黄金の蝶の群れに変わり、姿を消す。
Russian (RU): Поклонившись, Ронове превратился в стаю золотых бабочек и исчез.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Após se curvar uma vez, Ronove se transformou em uma nuvem de borboletas douradas, escondendo‐se.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 羅諾威行了一禮，化為黃金蝶群，消失了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 罗诺威行了一礼，化为黄金蝶群，消失了。

Umineko Project (UP): {f:5:Virgilia} turned Gaap from a sculpture into a group of gold butterflies, and then turned into a cloud of them herself, which mixed in with the others and disappeared.
Steam (ST): After turning Gaap, who had become a sculpture, into a cloud of gold butterflies, {f:5:Virgilia} also turned into a cloud, which mixed in with the others and disappeared.
PC Japanese (JP): ワルギリアは、彫像に変えられてしまったガァプを黄金の蝶の群にして消し去ってから、自らも蝶の群になり、それに混じり合って姿を消した。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): ワルギリアは、彫像に変えられてしまったガァプを黄金の蝶の群れにして消し去ってから、自らも蝶の群れになり、それに混じり合って姿を消した。
Russian (RU): После того, как Гаап, ставшая скульптурой, превратилась в золотых бабочек, {f:5:Вергилия} тоже превратилась в стайку бабочек, которые смешались с остальными, и исчезла.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): {f:5:Virgilia} transformou Gaap, de uma escultura, para um grupo de borboletas douradas, e as transformou em uma nuvem, que, misturada com outras, desapareceu.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 瓦爾基莉亞先將變成雕像的噶普化為了黃金蝶群，接著自己也變成蝶群，與其一同消失了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 瓦尔基莉亚先将变成雕像的噶普化为了黄金蝶群，接着自己也变成蝶群，与其一同消失了。

Umineko Project (UP): ............In the study made untidy by drinking, ......{f:5:Beatrice} stood still, alone.
Steam (ST): ......In the study made untidy by drinking, ...{f:5:Beatrice} stood still, alone.
PC Japanese (JP): …………飲み散らかされた、書斎に、……ベアトリーチェはひとり、立ち尽くしている。
Russian (RU): ............В рабочем кабинете, ставшим неопрятным из‐за вечеринки... осталась одна {f:5:Беатриче}.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ............No estúdio desmazelado pela bebida, ......{f:5:Beatrice} permaneceu, sozinha.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …………在因痛飲狂歡而搞得一片狼籍的書房中，……貝阿朵莉切獨自佇立。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …………在因痛饮狂欢而搞得一片狼籍的书房中，……贝阿朵莉切独自伫立。

Umineko Project (UP): Since the time she had returned, her expression hadn't changed in the slightest...
Steam (ST): Since the time she had returned, her expression hadn't changed in the slightest...
PC Japanese (JP): その表情は、戻ってきた時から、わずかほども変わらない…。
Russian (RU): С момента её возвращения в кабинет выражение её лица ни капли не изменилось...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Desde o momento em que retornou, sua expressão não mudou minimamente...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 其表情，從剛才回來時起，未曾有過一絲的變化…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 其表情，从刚才回来时起，未曾有过一丝的变化…。

Umineko Project (UP): ......However, when she saw the fallen empty wine bottles and scattered cheese plates, her brow furrowed, and she looked a bit displeased.
Steam (ST): ...However, when she saw the fallen empty wine bottles and scattered cheese plates, her brow furrowed, and she looked a bit displeased.
PC Japanese (JP): ……しかし、転がったワインの空き瓶や散らかったチーズの皿などに気付くと、少しだけ不快そうに眉をひそめた。
Russian (RU): ......Однако, когда она увидела упавшие пустые бутылки из‐под вина и разбросанные тарелки для сыра, она нахмурила брови, что придало её облику немного рассерженности.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Entretanto, quando ela viu garrafas de vinho vazias caídas no chão e pratos de queijos espalhados, suas sobrancelhas franziram, parecendo um pouco desagradada.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……不過，當她注意到倒著的空酒瓶與狼籍的盛奶酪的盤子時，略顯不快地眉頭一皺。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……不过，当她注意到倒着的空酒瓶与狼籍的盛奶酪的盘子时，略显不快地眉头一皱。

Umineko Project (UP): And when she whispered "disappear", in that instant, the room flashed, and was tidy again, as though nothing had ever happened.
Steam (ST): And when she whispered "disappear", in that instant, the room was cleaned up in a flash, as though nothing had happened.
PC Japanese (JP): そして一言、消えろと呟くと、その瞬間、部屋は瞬き、何事もなかったかのように片付いた。
Russian (RU): И когда она прошептала: "Исчезните", комната в мгновение ока оказалась прибранной, как будто ничего не произошло.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): E quando ela sussurrou "desaparecem", no mesmo instante, o quarto brilhou, e mais uma vez estava arrumado, como se nada tivesse acontecido.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 接著，隨著一聲“消失吧”，在那一瞬間，房間一下子就如什麼都沒發生過般地被收拾乾淨了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 接着，随着一声“消失吧”，在那一瞬间，房间一下子就如什么都没发生过般地被收拾干净了。

Umineko Project (UP): The reception chairs were neatly arranged, and there was no wine or cheese.{n}There were no stains where things had been spilled, nor was there any scattered trash.
Steam (ST): The reception chairs were neatly arranged, and there was no wine or cheese. There were no stains or scattered trash either.
PC Japanese (JP): 応接席は綺麗に整い、ワインもチーズもない。零した汚れも、散らかしたゴミもない。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 応接席は綺麗に整い、ワインもチーズもない。{n}零した汚れも、散らかしたゴミもない。
Russian (RU): Стулья были аккуратно расставлены и исчезли бутылки с вином и сыр.{n}Не стало пятен и разбросанного мусора.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): As cadeiras para os visitantes estavam perfeitamente alinhadas, e não havia mais vinhos ou queijos.{n}Não haviam mais manchas onde coisas teriam sido derramadas, nem qualquer lixo espalhado.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 會客席收拾得很乾淨，沒有酒、沒有奶酪。{n}沒有污漬，沒有散落的垃圾。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 会客席收拾得很干净，没有酒、没有奶酪。{n}没有污渍，没有散落的垃圾。

Umineko Project (UP): ......To the contrary, even the air had frozen over, and, enough to make one doubt whether so many noisy people really had been in this room until just moments ago, .........the study had returned to total silence.
Steam (ST): ...To the contrary, even the air had frozen over, and, enough to make one doubt whether a large number of noisy people really had been in this room until a short while ago, ......the study had returned to silence.
PC Japanese (JP): ……それどころか、空気さえも冷え切り、この部屋についさっきまで、あれだけの人数が賑やかにしていたことさえも疑わせるほどに、………静かな書斎に戻った。
Russian (RU): Более того, застыл даже воздух, и кабинет погрузился в такую тишину, что трудно было поверить, будто недавно он был полон шумного народу.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Pelo contrário, até mesmo o ar havia congelado, e, suficiente o bastante para deixar dúbio se realmente teria tido tantas pessoas agitadas naquele quarto até instantes atrás, .........o estúdio retornou ao silêncio absoluto.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……不僅如此，連空氣都涼透了，此處變回了，甚至令人對“直到剛才還有那麼多人在這房中歡鬧”一事產生懷疑的，………安靜的書房。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……不仅如此，连空气都凉透了，此处变回了，甚至令人对“直到刚才还有那么多人在这房中欢闹”一事产生怀疑的，………安静的书房。

Umineko Project (UP): .........In that silent, ......frigid study where even the air had frozen, {f:5:Beatrice} stood still...
Steam (ST): ......In that silent, ...frigid study where even the air had frozen, {f:5:Beatrice} stood still...
PC Japanese (JP): ………その、沈黙の、……空気さえも凍ってしまった寒々しい書斎に、ベアトリーチェは立ち尽くしていた…。
Russian (RU): В этом тихом... холодном кабинете, где застыл даже воздух, осталась только {f:5:Беатриче}...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): .........Naquele silêncio, ......no apático estúdio, onde até mesmo o ar havia congelado, {f:5:Beatrice} permaneceu imóvel...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ………在這一片沉寂，……連空氣都凍住了的冰冷的書房中，貝阿朵莉切孑然佇立…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ………在这一片沉寂，……连空气都冻住了的冰冷的书房中，贝阿朵莉切孑然伫立…。

Umineko Project (UP): Then, she called him in a mutter.
Steam (ST): Then, she called, muttering.

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Então, ela o chamou em murmúrios.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 接著，她低聲喚道。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 接着，她低声唤道。

Speaker: {f:5:Beatrice}
Umineko Project (UP): "..................Battler. Are you there?"
Steam (ST): ".........Battler, are you there?"

Umineko Project (UP): "......I've been here for a while. .........What the hell's going on with you? You've been acting strange."
Steam (ST): "...I've been here for a while. ......What the hell's going on with you? You've been strange since a short while ago."

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……さっきからいるぜ。………何なんだ、一体お前は。さっきから変だぜ」
Russian (RU): "......Я здесь уже некоторое время. .........Какого чёрта с тобой происходит? С недавнего времени ты странно себя ведёшь."

Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……从刚才起就在。………你究竟在搞啥呀？从刚才起就怪怪的。」

Speaker: {f:5:Beatrice}
Umineko Project (UP): "Do I seem strange? My apologies."
Steam (ST): "Do I seem strange? My apologies."
PC Japanese (JP): 「変に見えるか。それは済まぬな。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「変に見えるか。それは済まぬな」
Russian (RU): "Я кажусь странной? Извини."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Eu pareço estranha? Desculpe por isso."

Chinese Simplified (CN): 「妾身看起来怪怪的吗？这倒是抱歉啊。」

Speaker: Ushiromiya Battler

There will be no advancing, no retreating, no taking or being taken. No victory, no defeat, not even a tie. Just abandoned."
Steam (ST): "......I said that nothing would end. With this, everything will be abandoned. The game will be forgotten, and the pieces on the board will be abandoned as they lay. There will be no advancing or returning, no taking and being taken. No victory, no defeat, not even a tie. Just abandoned."
